pullRequest.title: MULE-18047: Add the component that generated a cursor provider

commit.message: MULE-18047: Add the component that generated a cursor provider

nodes.bodyText: mention just setting a property. This is valid for command line, but in CH or runtime fabric these are set differently

commit.message: Move troubleshooting related stuff to implementation

nodes.bodyText: do this AFTER setting the closed flag
add the version in which it was deprecated

the SP should not be consumed here. This should be just a final instance attribute provided by the constructor. Otherwise, we don't only loose the ability to spot enable it, it also requires ugly reflection on the test cases. The SystemProperty should be consumed on the AbstractCursorProviderFactory
same as before. The SP should be consumed in one unique spot and then propagated through constructors

+   * @param originatingLocation indicates where the cursor was created
    */
-  public InMemoryCursorIteratorProvider(Iterator stream, InMemoryCursorIteratorConfig config) {
-    super(stream);
+  public InMemoryCursorIteratorProvider(Iterator stream, InMemoryCursorIteratorConfig config,

nodes.bodyText: don't just make it static... resolve the value statically.. the original comment aims to not resolving the SP each time the factory is created

commit.message: Make SP to enable close providers tracking static

nodes.bodyText:
I don't understand how this test can pass. First parametrization runs fine, but for the second one, this value is not updated.
To avoid reflection hackerism, you can add a setCursorProviderCloseTracking(boolean enabled) method on the abstract factories (not in the API interface)
